013package org.apache.juneau.bean.openapi3;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArrayUtils.contains;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
018
019import java.util.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025
026/**
027 * Describes a single operation parameter.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * A unique parameter is defined by a combination of a name and location.
031 *
032 * <p>
033 * There are five possible parameter types.
034 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
035 *    <li><js>"path"</js> - Used together with Path Templating, where the parameter value is actually part of the
036 *       operation's URL.
037 *       This does not include the host or base path of the API.
038 *       For example, in <code>/items/{itemId}</code>, the path parameter is <code>itemId</code>.
039 *    <li><js>"query"</js> - Parameters that are appended to the URL.
040 *       For example, in <code>/items?id=###</code>, the query parameter is <code>id</code>.
041 *    <li><js>"header"</js> - Custom headers that are expected as part of the request.
042 *    <li><js>"body"</js> - The payload that's appended to the HTTP request.
043 *       Since there can only be one payload, there can only be one body parameter.
044 *       The name of the body parameter has no effect on the parameter itself and is used for documentation purposes
045 *       only.
046 *       Since Form parameters are also in the payload, body and form parameters cannot exist together for the same
047 *       operation.
048 *    <li><js>"formData"</js> - Used to describe the payload of an HTTP request when either
049 *       <code>application/x-www-form-urlencoded</code>, <code>multipart/form-data</code> or both are used as the
050 *       content type of the request (in Swagger's definition, the consumes property of an operation).
051 *       This is the only parameter type that can be used to send files, thus supporting the file type.
052 *       Since form parameters are sent in the payload, they cannot be declared together with a body parameter for the
053 *       same operation.
054 *       Form parameters have a different format based on the content-type used (for further details, consult
055 *       <code>http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/interact/forms.html#h-17.13.4</code>):
056 *       <ul>
057 *          <li><js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js> - Similar to the format of Query parameters but as a
058 *             payload.
059 *             For example, <code>foo=1&amp;bar=swagger</code> - both <code>foo</code> and <code>bar</code> are form
060 *             parameters.
061 *             This is normally used for simple parameters that are being transferred.
062 *          <li><js>"multipart/form-data"</js> - each parameter takes a section in the payload with an internal header.
063 *             For example, for the header <code>Content-Disposition: form-data; name="submit-name"</code> the name of
064 *             the parameter is <code>submit-name</code>.
065 *             This type of form parameters is more commonly used for file transfers.
066 *       </ul>
067 *    </li>
068 * </ul>
069 *
070 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
071 * <p class='bcode'>
072 *    <jc>// Construct using SwaggerBuilder.</jc>
073 *    ParameterInfo x = <jsm>parameterInfo</jsm>(<js>"query"</js>, <js>"foo"</js>);
074 *
075 *    <jc>// Serialize using JsonSerializer.</jc>
076 *    String json = JsonSerializer.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.toString(x);
077 *
078 *    <jc>// Or just use toString() which does the same as above.</jc>
079 *    String json = x.toString();
080 * </p>
081 * <p class='bcode'>
082 *    <jc>// Output</jc>
083 *    {
084 *       <js>"in"</js>: <js>"query"</js>,
085 *       <js>"name"</js>: <js>"foo"</js>
086 *    }
087 * </p>
088 */
089@Bean(properties="in,name,type,description,scheme,bearerFormat,flows,*")
090@FluentSetters
091public class SecuritySchemeInfo extends OpenApiElement {
092
093   private static final String[] VALID_IN = {"query", "header", "cookie"};
094   private static final String[] VALID_TYPES = {"apiKey", "http", "oauth2", "openIdConnect"};
095
096   private String
097      type,
098      description,
099      name,
100      in,
101      scheme,
102      bearerFormat,
103      openIdConnectUrl;
104
105   private OAuthFlow flows;
106
107   /**
108    * Default constructor.
109    */
110   public SecuritySchemeInfo() {}
111
112   /**
113    * Copy constructor.
114    *
115    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
116    */
117   public SecuritySchemeInfo(SecuritySchemeInfo copyFrom) {
118      super(copyFrom);
119
120      this.name = copyFrom.name;
121      this.in = copyFrom.in;
122      this.description = copyFrom.description;
123      this.type = copyFrom.type;
124      this.scheme = copyFrom.scheme;
125      this.bearerFormat = copyFrom.bearerFormat;
126      this.openIdConnectUrl = copyFrom.openIdConnectUrl;
127      this.flows = copyFrom.flows;
128   }
129
130   /**
131    * Make a deep copy of this object.
132    *
133    * @return A deep copy of this object.
134    */
135   public SecuritySchemeInfo copy() {
136      return new SecuritySchemeInfo(this);
137   }
138
139   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
140   protected SecuritySchemeInfo strict() {
141      super.strict();
142      return this;
143   }
144
145   /**
146    * Bean property getter:  <property>name</property>.
147    *
148    * <p>
149    * The name of the parameter.
150    *
151    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5>
152    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
153    *    <li>
154    *       Parameter names are case sensitive.
155    *    <li>
156    *       If <code>in</code> is <js>"path"</js>, the <code>name</code> field MUST correspond to the associated path segment
157    *       from the <code>path</code> field in the paths object.
158    *    <li>
159    *       For all other cases, the name corresponds to the parameter name used based on the <code>in</code> property.
160    * </ul>
161    *
162    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
163    */
164   public String getName() {
165      return name;
166   }
167
168   /**
169    * Bean property setter:  <property>name</property>.
170    *
171    * <p>
172    * The name of the parameter.
173    *
174    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5>
175    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
176    *    <li>
177    *       Parameter names are case sensitive.
178    *    <li>
179    *       If <code>in</code> is <js>"path"</js>, the <code>name</code> field MUST correspond to the associated path segment
180    *       from the <code>path</code> field in the paths object.
181    *    <li>
182    *       For all other cases, the name corresponds to the parameter name used based on the <code>in</code> property.
183    * </ul>
184    *
185    * @param value
186    *    The new value for this property.
187    *    <br>Property value is required.
188    * @return This object
189    */
190   public SecuritySchemeInfo setName(String value) {
191      name = value;
192      return this;
193   }
194
195   /**
196    * Bean property getter:  <property>in</property>.
197    *
198    * <p>
199    * The location of the parameter.
200    *
201    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
202    */
203   public String getIn() {
204      return in;
205   }
206
207   /**
208    * Bean property setter:  <property>in</property>.
209    *
210    * <p>
211    * The location of the parameter.
212    *
213    * @param value
214    *    The new value for this property.
215    *    <br>Valid values:
216    *    <ul>
217    *       <li><js>"query"</js>
218    *       <li><js>"header"</js>
219    *       <li><js>"path"</js>
220    *       <li><js>"formData"</js>
221    *       <li><js>"body"</js>
222    *    </ul>
223    *    <br>Property value is required.
224    * @return This object
225    */
226   public SecuritySchemeInfo setIn(String value) {
227      if (isStrict() && ! contains(value, VALID_IN))
228         throw new BasicRuntimeException(
229            "Invalid value passed in to setIn(String).  Value=''{0}'', valid values={1}",
230            value, VALID_IN
231         );
232      in = value;
233      return this;
234   }
235
236   /**
237    * Bean property getter:  <property>description</property>.
238    *
239    * <p>
240    * A brief description of the parameter.
241    * <br>This could contain examples of use.
242    *
243    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
244    */
245   public String getDescription() {
246      return description;
247   }
248
249   /**
250    * Bean property setter:  <property>description</property>.
251    *
252    * <p>
253    * A brief description of the parameter.
254    * <br>This could contain examples of use.
255    *
256    * @param value
257    *    The new value for this property.
258    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
259    * @return This object
260    */
261   public SecuritySchemeInfo setDescription(String value) {
262      description = value;
263      return this;
264   }
265
266   /**
267    * Bean property getter:  <property>schema</property>.
268    *
269    * <p>
270    * The schema defining the type used for the body parameter.
271    *
272    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
273    */
274   public String getScheme() {
275      return scheme;
276   }
277
278   /**
279    * Bean property setter:  <property>schema</property>.
280    *
281    * <p>
282    * The schema defining the type used for the body parameter.
283    *
284    * @param value
285    *    The new value for this property.
286    *    <br>Property value is required.
287    * @return This object
288    */
289   public SecuritySchemeInfo setScheme(String value) {
290      scheme = value;
291      return this;
292   }
293
294   /**
295    * Bean property getter:  <property>type</property>.
296    *
297    * <p>
298    * The type of the parameter.
299    *
300    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
301    */
302   public String getType() {
303      return type;
304   }
305
306   /**
307    * Bean property setter:  <property>type</property>.
308    *
309    * <p>
310    * The type of the parameter.
311    *
312    * @param value
313    *    The new value for this property.
314    *    <br>Valid values:
315    *    <ul>
316    *       <li><js>"string"</js>
317    *       <li><js>"number"</js>
318    *       <li><js>"integer"</js>
319    *       <li><js>"boolean"</js>
320    *       <li><js>"array"</js>
321    *       <li><js>"file"</js>
322    *    </ul>
323    *    <br>If type is <js>"file"</js>, the <code>consumes</code> MUST be either <js>"multipart/form-data"</js>, <js>"application/x-www-form-urlencoded"</js>
324    *       or both and the parameter MUST be <code>in</code> <js>"formData"</js>.
325    *    <br>Property value is required.
326    * @return This object
327    */
328   public SecuritySchemeInfo setType(String value) {
329      if (isStrict() && ! contains(value, VALID_TYPES))
330         throw new BasicRuntimeException(
331            "Invalid value passed in to setType(String).  Value=''{0}'', valid values={1}",
332            value, VALID_TYPES
333         );
334      type = value;
335      return this;
336   }
337
338   /**
339    * Bean property getter:  <property>format</property>.
340    *
341    * <p>
342    * The extending format for the previously mentioned type.
343    *
344    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
345    */
346   public String getBearerFormat() {
347      return bearerFormat;
348   }
349
350   /**
351    * Bean property setter:  <property>format</property>.
352    *
353    * <p>
354    * The extending format for the previously mentioned type.
355    *
356    * @param value The new value for this property.
357    * @return This object
358    */
359   public SecuritySchemeInfo setBearerFormat(String value) {
360      bearerFormat = value;
361      return this;
362   }
363
364   /**
365    * Bean property getter:  <property>items</property>.
366    *
367    * <p>
368    * Describes the type of items in the array.
369    *
370    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
371    */
372   public OAuthFlow getFlows() {
373      return flows;
374   }
375
376   /**
377    * Bean property setter:  <property>items</property>.
378    *
379    * <p>
380    * Describes the type of items in the array.
381    *
382    * @param value
383    *    The new value for this property.
384    *    <br>Property value is required if <code>type</code> is <js>"array"</js>.
385    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
386    * @return This object
387    */
388   public SecuritySchemeInfo setFlows(OAuthFlow value) {
389      flows = value;
390      return this;
391   }
392
393   /**
394    * Bean property getter:  <property>collectionFormat</property>.
395    *
396    * <p>
397    * Determines the format of the array if type array is used.
398    *
399    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
400    */
401   public String getOpenIdConnectUrl() {
402      return openIdConnectUrl;
403   }
404
405   /**
406    * Bean property setter:  <property>collectionFormat</property>.
407    *
408    * <p>
409    * Determines the format of the array if type array is used.
410    *
411    * @param value The new value for this property.
412    * @return This object
413    */
414   public SecuritySchemeInfo setOpenIdConnectUrl(String value) {
415      openIdConnectUrl = value;
416      return this;
417   }
418
419   // <FluentSetters>
420
421   // </FluentSetters>
422
423   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
424   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
425      if (property == null)
426         return null;
427      return switch (property) {
428         case "name" -> toType(getName(), type);
429         case "in" -> toType(getIn(), type);
430         case "description" -> toType(getDescription(), type);
431         case "scheme" -> toType(getScheme(), type);
432         case "flows" -> toType(getFlows(), type);
433         case "bearerFormat" -> toType(getBearerFormat(), type);
434         case "openIdConnectUrl" -> toType(getOpenIdConnectUrl(), type);
435         case "type" -> toType(getType(), type);
436         default -> super.get(property, type);
437      };
438   }
439
440   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
441   public SecuritySchemeInfo set(String property, Object value) {
442      if (property == null)
443         return this;
444      return switch (property) {
445         case "name" -> setName(Utils.s(value));
446         case "in" -> setIn(Utils.s(value));
447         case "description" -> setDescription(Utils.s(value));
448         case "scheme" -> setScheme(Utils.s(value));
449         case "bearerFormat" -> setBearerFormat(Utils.s(value));
450         case "type" -> setType(Utils.s(value));
451         case "flows" -> setFlows(toType(value, OAuthFlow.class));
452         case "openIdConnectUrl" -> setOpenIdConnectUrl(Utils.s(value));
453         default -> {
454            super.set(property, value);
455            yield this;
456         }
457      };
458   }
459
460   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
461   public Set<String> keySet() {
462      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
463         .addIf(name != null, "name")
464         .addIf(in != null, "in")
465         .addIf(description != null, "description")
466         .addIf(scheme != null, "scheme")
467         .addIf(bearerFormat != null, "bearerFormat")
468         .addIf(type != null, "type")
469         .addIf(flows != null, "flows")
470         .addIf(openIdConnectUrl != null, "openIdConnectUrl")
471         .build();
472      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
473   }
474}
